intro: Leucas minahassae, commonly known as the Malabar leucas, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Asia, particularly India and Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, dry fruits containing seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
